title: The Ku Klux Klan In American Politics
description: The Klu Klux Clan in American Politics -- The KKK of the 20th century has been a many sided organization. Comprising its creed have been half dozen or so tenets. To carry out its programs based upon these articles of faith, the secret order has used a variety of political methods. This book documents some of that activity covering the period 1915 to 1962. -- Contrary to general belief, Klanism was nationwide, with local chapters in every state, and in the 1920s the secret order achieved tremendous power and success. Nevertheless, the Klan was predominantly a southern phenomenon, so this work necessarily lays stress on Klanism in the south
